perturbation.original_text: This Agreement shall be automatically renewed for additional extended terms each of two (2) years duration unless either party notifies the other in writing of its intention not to renew the Agreement, such notification to be provided at least ninety (90) days prior to the expiration of the then in-effect term.
perturbation.changed_text: This Agreement may be renewed for additional extended terms each of two (2) years duration only upon mutual written agreement by both Parties at least ninety (90) days prior to the expiration of the then in-effect term. If no such agreement is reached, the agreement will terminate. For the avoidance of doubt, the agreement does not automatically renew.
perturbation.explanation: The original text stated that the agreement auto-renews unless a party opts out. The modified version states that renewal requires explicit agreement, directly contradicting the original.

perturbation.original_text: COMPANY may, in its unfettered discretion, terminate this Agreement at any time after first givingCONTENT PROVIDER ten (10) days advance notice thereof.
perturbation.changed_text: COMPANY may, in its sole but reasonably exercised discretion, terminate this Agreement at any time for good cause, such as breach of contract, material misrepresentation or change in business conditions, after first giving CONTENT PROVIDER thirty (30) days advance notice thereof.
perturbation.explanation: The original text allowed COMPANY to terminate the agreement at its sole discretion. The modified version limits this discretion by requiring a 'good cause' and increasing the notice period, creating a contradiction on the termination rights.

perturbation.changed_text: IN NO EVENT WILL CONTENT PROVIDER BE LIABLE TO COMPANY NOR WILL COMPANY BE LIABLE TO CONTENT PROVIDER FOR ANY SPECIAL, INCIDENTAL OR CONSEQUENTIAL DAMAGES, WHETHER BASED ON BREACH OF CONTRACT, TORT (INCLUDING NEGLIGENCE) OR OTHERWISE, WHETHER OR NOT THAT PARTY HAS BEEN ADVISED OF THE POSSIBILITY OF SUCH DAMAGE. THE LIABILITY OF CONTENT PROVIDER FOR DIRECT DAMAGES HEREUNDER, WHETHER IN CONTRACT, TORT OR ANY OTHER LEGAL THEORY, IS UNLIMITED.
perturbation.explanation: The original text limited CONTENT PROVIDER's liability to $31,200.00. The modified version removes this cap, while still maintaining that special, incidental, or consequential damages are not liable. This creates an internal contradiction about the extent of CONTENT PROVIDER liability.
